intro: [WRONG START] Rubus protensen, commonly known as the red raspberry. It is a deciduous shrub native to Europe and parts of Asia, characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits called drupes, which are typically bright red when ripe. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in woodland edges and disturbed soils. Rubus protensus is valued for its edible fruits and is also used in traditional herbal medicine.
